revised_title: Anatomy and Physiology of Spongiadae: Part II
tldr: The author examines the anatomy and physiology of sponges, focusing on their fibrous skeleton and the substance called keratode. They compare the composition of sponges to that of silk and other zoophytes, concluding that sponges are part of the animal kingdom. The author also describes different types of tissues found in sponges and their structural organization.
